title: Periodic waves - pressure-time graphs of waves 123

content.question: Three sound waves, Wave <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, Wave <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and Wave <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, travel through air at the same temperature and pressure. The gauge pressure <math alttext="delta P" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Δ</mi><mi>P</mi></math> (difference between the pressure at a location and atmospheric pressure) as a function of time <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> for each wave is shown in the three graphs. Which of the following correctly compares the wavelengths <math alttext="lambda sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>, <math alttext="lambda sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, and <math alttext="lambda sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math> of waves <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>, <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>, and <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math>, respectively? Note that the graphs all use the same scale for both pressure and time.

choices.label: <math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, lambda sub 3, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub 1, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 3, end sub, which is greater than, lambda sub 2, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub 2, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 3, end sub, which is greater than, lambda sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="lambda sub 3, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 2, end sub, which is greater than, lambda sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="lambda sub 2, end sub, is greater than, lambda sub 3, end sub, which is greater than, lambda sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>λ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
